item.cobblemon.fast_ball.tooltip: 4× on Pokémon with 100 or more Base Speed
item.cobblemon.level_ball.tooltip: 1× to 4×, increases the higher the player's Pokémon level is compared to the target
item.cobblemon.lure_ball.tooltip: 2× on Water-types, until fishing is added
item.cobblemon.love_ball.tooltip: 2.5× if the target is the opposite gender of the player's Pokémon, 8× if also the same species
item.cobblemon.moon_ball.tooltip: 1× to 4×, increases at night depending on how close the moon phase is to a full moon
item.cobblemon.nest_ball.tooltip: 1× to 4×, increases the lower the target's level is from 30
item.cobblemon.timer_ball.tooltip: 1× to 4×, increases by the number of turns passed, up to 10
item.cobblemon.luxury_ball.tooltip: 1×, caught Pokémon gain Friendship twice as fast
item.cobblemon.dusk_ball.tooltip: 3× if target is in Light Level 0, 1.5× if in Light Level 1-7
item.cobblemon.heal_ball.tooltip: 1×, fully restores HP, PP, and status conditions upon capture
item.cobblemon.quick_ball.tooltip: 5× on the first turn of battle
item.cobblemon.park_ball.tooltip: 2.5× in all Forest or Plains biomes

advancements.cobblemon.bone_meal_apricor: Don't have time to wait? Quickly grow Apricorns using bone meal
advancements.cobblemon.plant_apricorn.de: Plant your newly acquired seed back home to grow your very own Apricorn tree
advancements.cobblemon.rainbow_apricorns: Obtain one of each Apricorn variant

cobblemon.battle.item.power_herb.end: %1$s became fully charged due to its Power Herb!

cobblemon.battle.item.white_herb.end: %1$s returned its status to normal using its White Herb!

cobblemon.command.checkspawns.nothing: Nothing can spawn here right now.
cobblemon.move.pound.desc: The target is physically pounded with a long tail, a foreleg, or the like.
cobblemon.move.karatechop.desc: The target is attacked with a sharp chop. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.doubleslap.desc: The target is slapped repeatedly, back and forth, two to five times in a row.
cobblemon.move.cometpunch.desc: The target is hit with a flurry of punches that strike two to five times in a row.
cobblemon.move.megapunch.desc: The target is slugged by a punch thrown with muscle-packed power.
cobblemon.move.payday.desc: Numerous coins are hurled at the target to inflict damage. Money is earned after the battle.
cobblemon.move.firepunch.desc: The target is punched with a fiery fist. This may also leave the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.icepunch.desc: The target is punched with an icy fist. This may also leave the target frozen.
cobblemon.move.thunderpunch.desc: The target is punched with an electrified fist. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.scratch.desc: Hard, pointed, sharp claws rake the target to inflict damage.
cobblemon.move.vicegrip.desc: The target is gripped and squeezed from both sides to inflict damage.
cobblemon.move.guillotine.desc: A vicious, tearing attack with big pincers. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
cobblemon.move.razorwind.desc: In this two-turn attack, blades of wind hit opposing Pokémon on the second turn. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.swordsdance.desc: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.cut.desc: The target is cut with a scythe or claw.
cobblemon.move.gust.desc: A gust of wind is whipped up by wings and launched at the target to inflict damage.
cobblemon.move.wingattack.desc: The target is struck with large, imposing wings spread wide to inflict damage.
cobblemon.move.whirlwind.desc: The target is blown away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
cobblemon.move.fly.desc: The user soars and then strikes its target on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.bind.desc: Things such as long bodies or tentacles are used to bind and squeeze the target for four to five turns.
cobblemon.move.slam.desc: The target is slammed with a long tail, vines, or the like to inflict damage.
cobblemon.move.vinewhip.desc: The target is struck with slender, whiplike vines to inflict damage.
cobblemon.move.stomp.desc: The target is stomped with a big foot. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.doublekick.desc: The target is quickly kicked twice in succession using both feet.
cobblemon.move.megakick.desc: The target is attacked by a kick launched with muscle-packed power.
cobblemon.move.jumpkick.desc: The user jumps up high, then strikes with a kick. If the kick misses, the user hurts itself.
cobblemon.move.rollingkick.desc: The user lashes out with a quick, spinning kick. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.sandattack.desc: Sand is hurled in the target’s face, reducing the target’s accuracy.
cobblemon.move.headbutt.desc: The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging straight into the target. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.hornattack.desc: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed horn to inflict damage.
cobblemon.move.furyattack.desc: The target is jabbed repeatedly with a horn or beak two to five times in a row.
cobblemon.move.horndrill.desc: The user stabs the target with a horn that rotates like a drill. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
cobblemon.move.tackle.desc: A physical attack in which the user charges and slams into the target with its whole body.
cobblemon.move.bodyslam.desc: The user drops onto the target with its full body weight. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.wrap.desc: A long body, vines, or the like are used to wrap and  squeeze the target for four to five turns.
cobblemon.move.takedown.desc: A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into the target. This also damages the user a little.
cobblemon.move.thrash.desc: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
cobblemon.move.doubleedge.desc: A reckless, life-risking tackle. This also damages the user quite a lot.
cobblemon.move.tailwhip.desc: The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.poisonsting.desc: The user stabs the target with a poisonous stinger. This may also poison the target.
cobblemon.move.twineedle.desc: The user damages the target twice in succession by jabbing it with two spikes. This may also poison the target.
cobblemon.move.pinmissile.desc: Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.
cobblemon.move.leer.desc: The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating leer that lowers the Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.bite.desc: The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.growl.desc: The user growls in an endearing way, making opposing Pokémon less wary. This lowers their Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.roar.desc: The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
cobblemon.move.sing.desc: A soothing lullaby is sung in a calming voice that puts the target into a deep slumber.
cobblemon.move.supersonic.desc: The user generates odd sound waves from its body that confuse the target.
cobblemon.move.sonicboom.desc: The target is hit with a destructive shock wave that always inflicts 20 HP damage.
cobblemon.move.disable.desc: For four turns, this move prevents the target from using the move it last used.
cobblemon.move.acid.desc: The opposing Pokémon are attacked with a spray of harsh acid. This may also lower their Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.ember.desc: The target is attacked with small flames. This may also leave the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.flamethrower.desc: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.mist.desc: The user cloaks itself and its allies in a white mist that prevents any of their stats from being lowered for five turns.
cobblemon.move.watergun.desc: The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.
cobblemon.move.hydropump.desc: The target is blasted by a huge volume of water launched under great pressure.
cobblemon.move.surf.desc: The user attacks everything around it by swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.
cobblemon.move.icebeam.desc: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. This may also leave the target frozen.
cobblemon.move.blizzard.desc: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing Pokémon. This may also leave the opposing Pokémon frozen.
cobblemon.move.psybeam.desc: The target is attacked with a peculiar ray. This may also leave the target confused.
cobblemon.move.bubblebeam.desc: A spray of bubbles is forcefully ejected at the target. This may also lower its Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.aurorabeam.desc: The target is hit with a rainbow-colored beam. This may also lower the target’s Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.hyperbeam.desc: The target is attacked with a powerful beam. The user can’t move on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.peck.desc: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed beak or horn.
cobblemon.move.drillpeck.desc: A corkscrewing attack with a sharp beak acting as a drill.
cobblemon.move.submission.desc: The user grabs the target and recklessly dives for the ground. This also damages the user a little.
cobblemon.move.lowkick.desc: A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over. The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.counter.desc: A retaliation move that counters any physical attack, inflicting double the damage taken.
cobblemon.move.seismictoss.desc: The target is thrown using the power of gravity. It inflicts damage equal to the user’s level.
cobblemon.move.strength.desc: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power.
cobblemon.move.absorb.desc: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
cobblemon.move.megadrain.desc: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
cobblemon.move.leechseed.desc: A seed is planted on the target. It steals some HP from the target every turn.
cobblemon.move.growth.desc: The user’s body grows all at once, raising the Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
cobblemon.move.razorleaf.desc: Sharp-edged leaves are launched to slash at the opposing Pokémon. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.solarbeam.desc: In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.poisonpowder.desc: The user scatters a cloud of poisonous dust that poisons the target.
cobblemon.move.stunspore.desc: The user scatters a cloud of numbing powder that paralyzes the target.
cobblemon.move.sleeppowder.desc: The user scatters a big cloud of sleep-inducing dust around the target.
cobblemon.move.petaldance.desc: The user attacks the target by scattering petals for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
cobblemon.move.stringshot.desc: The opposing Pokémon are bound with silk blown from the user’s mouth that harshly lowers the Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.dragonrage.desc: This attack hits the target with a shock wave of pure rage. This attack always inflicts 40 HP damage.
cobblemon.move.firespin.desc: The target becomes trapped within a fierce vortex of fire that rages for four to five turns.
cobblemon.move.thundershock.desc: A jolt of electricity crashes down on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.thunderbolt.desc: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.thunderwave.desc: The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that paralyzes the target.
cobblemon.move.thunder.desc: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.rockthrow.desc: The user picks up and throws a small rock at the target to attack.
cobblemon.move.earthquake.desc: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it.
cobblemon.move.fissure.desc: The user opens up a fissure in the ground and drops the target in. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
cobblemon.move.dig.desc: The user burrows, then attacks on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.toxic.desc: A move that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.
cobblemon.move.confusion.desc: The target is hit by a weak telekinetic force. This may also confuse the target.
cobblemon.move.psychic.desc: The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.hypnosis.desc: The user employs hypnotic suggestion to make the target fall into a deep sleep.
cobblemon.move.meditate.desc: The user meditates to awaken the power deep within its body and raise its Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.agility.desc: The user relaxes and lightens its body to move faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.quickattack.desc: The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
cobblemon.move.rage.desc: As long as this move is in use, the power of rage raises the Attack stat each time the user is hit in battle.
cobblemon.move.teleport.desc: Use it to flee from any wild Pokémon.
cobblemon.move.nightshade.desc: The user makes the target see a frightening mirage. It inflicts damage equal to the user’s level.
cobblemon.move.mimic.desc: The user copies the target’s last move. The move can be used during battle until the Pokémon is switched out.
cobblemon.move.screech.desc: An earsplitting screech harshly lowers the target’s Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.doubleteam.desc: By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of itself to raise its evasiveness.
cobblemon.move.recover.desc: Restoring its own cells, the user restores its own HP by half of its max HP.
cobblemon.move.harden.desc: The user stiffens all the muscles in its body to raise its Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.minimize.desc: The user compresses its body to make itself look smaller, which sharply raises its evasiveness.
cobblemon.move.smokescreen.desc: The user releases an obscuring cloud of smoke or ink. This lowers the target’s accuracy.
cobblemon.move.confuseray.desc: The target is exposed to a sinister ray that triggers confusion.
cobblemon.move.withdraw.desc: The user withdraws its body into its hard shell, raising its Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.defensecurl.desc: The user curls up to conceal weak spots and raise its Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.barrier.desc: The user throws up a sturdy wall that sharply raises its Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.lightscreen.desc: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from special attacks for five turns.
cobblemon.move.haze.desc: The user creates a haze that eliminates every stat change among all the Pokémon engaged in battle.
cobblemon.move.reflect.desc: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from physical attacks for five turns.
cobblemon.move.focusenergy.desc: The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.bide.desc: The user endures attacks for two turns, then strikes back to cause double the damage taken.
cobblemon.move.metronome.desc: The user waggles a finger and stimulates its brain into randomly using nearly any move.
cobblemon.move.mirrormove.desc: The user counters the target by mimicking the target’s last move.
cobblemon.move.selfdestruct.desc: The user attacks everything around it by causing an explosion. The user faints upon using this move.
cobblemon.move.eggbomb.desc: A large egg is hurled at the target with maximum force to inflict damage.
cobblemon.move.lick.desc: The target is licked with a long tongue, causing damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.smog.desc: The target is attacked with a discharge of filthy gases. This may also poison the target.
cobblemon.move.sludge.desc: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target.
cobblemon.move.boneclub.desc: The user clubs the target with a bone. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.fireblast.desc: The target is attacked with an intense blast of all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.waterfall.desc: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch.
cobblemon.move.clamp.desc: The target is clamped and squeezed by the user’s very thick and sturdy shell for four to five turns.
cobblemon.move.swift.desc: Star-shaped rays are shot at the opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.
cobblemon.move.skullbash.desc: The user tucks in its head to raise its Defense stat on the first turn, then rams the target on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.spikecannon.desc: Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.
cobblemon.move.constrict.desc: The target is attacked with long, creeping tentacles, vines, or the like. This may also lower the target’s  Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.amnesia.desc: The user temporarily empties its mind to forget its concerns. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.kinesis.desc: The user distracts the target by bending a spoon. This lowers the target’s accuracy.
cobblemon.move.softboiled.desc: The user restores its own HP by up to half of its max HP.
cobblemon.move.highjumpkick.desc: The target is attacked with a knee kick from a jump. If it misses, the user is hurt instead.
cobblemon.move.glare.desc: The user intimidates the target with the pattern on its belly to cause paralysis.
cobblemon.move.dreameater.desc: The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target. It absorbs half the damage caused to heal its own HP.
cobblemon.move.poisongas.desc: A cloud of poison gas is sprayed in the face of opposing Pokémon, poisoning those hit.
cobblemon.move.barrage.desc: Round objects are hurled at the target to strike two to five times in a row.
cobblemon.move.leechlife.desc: The user drains the target’s blood. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
cobblemon.move.lovelykiss.desc: With a scary face, the user tries to force a kiss on the target. If it succeeds, the target falls asleep.
cobblemon.move.skyattack.desc: A second-turn attack move where critical hits land more easily. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.transform.desc: The user transforms into a copy of the target right down to having the same move set.
cobblemon.move.bubble.desc: A spray of countless bubbles is jetted at the opposing Pokémon. This may also lower their Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.dizzypunch.desc: The target is hit with rhythmically launched punches. This may also leave the target confused.
cobblemon.move.spore.desc: The user scatters bursts of spores that induce sleep.
cobblemon.move.flash.desc: The user flashes a bright light that cuts the target’s accuracy.
cobblemon.move.psywave.desc: The target is attacked with an odd psychic wave. The attack varies in intensity.
cobblemon.move.splash.desc: The user just flops and splashes around to no effect at all...
cobblemon.move.acidarmor.desc: The user alters its cellular structure to liquefy itself, sharply raising its Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.crabhammer.desc: The target is hammered with a large pincer. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.explosion.desc: The user attacks everything around it by causing a tremendous explosion. The user faints upon using this move.
cobblemon.move.furyswipes.desc: The target is raked with sharp claws or scythes quickly two to five times in a row.
cobblemon.move.bonemerang.desc: The user throws the bone it holds. The bone loops around to hit the target twice—coming and going.
cobblemon.move.rest.desc: The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully restores the user’s HP and heals any status conditions.
cobblemon.move.rockslide.desc: Large boulders are hurled at the opposing Pokémon to inflict damage. This may also make the opposing Pokémon flinch.
cobblemon.move.hyperfang.desc: The user bites hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.sharpen.desc: The user makes its edges more jagged,  which raises its Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.conversion.desc: The user changes its type to become the same type as the move at the top of the list of moves it knows.
cobblemon.move.triattack.desc: The user strikes with a simultaneous three-beam attack. May also burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.
cobblemon.move.superfang.desc: The user chomps hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. This cuts the target’s HP in half.
cobblemon.move.slash.desc: The target is attacked with a slash of claws or blades. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.substitute.desc: The user makes a copy of itself using some of its HP. The copy serves as the user’s decoy.
cobblemon.move.struggle.desc: This attack is used in desperation only if the user has no PP. It also damages the user a little.
cobblemon.move.sketch.desc: It enables the user to permanently learn the move last used by the target. Once used, Sketch disappears.
cobblemon.move.triplekick.desc: A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each successive hit.
cobblemon.move.thief.desc: The user attacks and steals the target’s held item simultaneously. The user can’t steal anything if it already holds an item.
cobblemon.move.spiderweb.desc: The user ensnares the target with thin, gooey silk so it can’t flee from battle.
cobblemon.move.mindreader.desc: The user senses the target’s movements with its mind to ensure its next attack does not miss the target.
cobblemon.move.nightmare.desc: A sleeping target sees a nightmare that inflicts some damage every turn.
cobblemon.move.flamewheel.desc: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.snore.desc: This attack can be used only if the user is asleep. The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.curse.desc: A move that works differently for the Ghost type than for all other types.
cobblemon.move.flail.desc: The user flails about aimlessly to attack. The less HP the user has, the greater the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.conversion2.desc: The user changes its type to make itself resistant to the type of the attack the opponent used last.
cobblemon.move.aeroblast.desc: A vortex of air is shot at the target to inflict damage. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.cottonspore.desc: The user releases cotton-like spores that cling to the opposing Pokémon, which harshly lowers their Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.reversal.desc: An all-out attack that becomes more powerful the less HP the user has.
cobblemon.move.spite.desc: The user unleashes its grudge on the move last used by the target by cutting 4 PP from it.
cobblemon.move.powdersnow.desc: The user attacks with a chilling gust of powdery snow. This may also freeze the opposing Pokémon.
cobblemon.move.protect.desc: Enables the user to evade all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
cobblemon.move.machpunch.desc: The user throws a punch at blinding speed. This move always goes first.
cobblemon.move.scaryface.desc: The user frightens the target with a scary face to harshly lower its Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.feintattack.desc: The user approaches the target disarmingly, then throws a sucker punch. This attack never misses.
cobblemon.move.sweetkiss.desc: The user kisses the target with a sweet, angelic cuteness that causes confusion.
cobblemon.move.bellydrum.desc: The user maximizes its Attack stat in exchange for HP equal to half its max HP.
cobblemon.move.sludgebomb.desc: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target.
cobblemon.move.mudslap.desc: The user hurls mud in the target’s face to inflict damage and lower its accuracy.
cobblemon.move.octazooka.desc: The user attacks by spraying ink in the target’s face or eyes. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
cobblemon.move.spikes.desc: The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing team’s feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch into battle.
cobblemon.move.zapcannon.desc: The user fires an electric blast like a cannon to inflict damage and cause paralysis.
cobblemon.move.foresight.desc: Enables a Ghost-type target to be hit by Normal- and Fighting-type attacks. This also enables an evasive target to be hit.
cobblemon.move.destinybond.desc: After using this move, if the user faints, the Pokémon that landed the knockout hit also faints. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
cobblemon.move.perishsong.desc: Any Pokémon that hears this song faints in three turns, unless it switches out of battle.
cobblemon.move.icywind.desc: The user attacks with a gust of chilled air. This also lowers the opposing Pokémon’s Speed stats.
cobblemon.move.detect.desc: Enables the user to evade all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
cobblemon.move.bonerush.desc: The user strikes the target with a hard bone two to five times in a row.
cobblemon.move.lockon.desc: The user takes sure aim at the target. This ensures the next attack does not miss the target.
cobblemon.move.outrage.desc: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
cobblemon.move.sandstorm.desc: A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all combatants except the Rock, Ground, and Steel types. It raises the Sp. Def stat of Rock types.
cobblemon.move.gigadrain.desc: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
cobblemon.move.endure.desc: The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
cobblemon.move.charm.desc: The user gazes at the target rather charmingly, making it less wary. This harshly lowers its Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.rollout.desc: The user continually rolls into the target over five turns. It becomes more powerful each time it hits.
cobblemon.move.falseswipe.desc: A restrained attack that prevents the target from fainting. The target is left with at least 1 HP.
cobblemon.move.swagger.desc: The user enrages and confuses the target. However, this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.milkdrink.desc: The user restores its own HP by up to half of its max HP.
cobblemon.move.spark.desc: The user throws an electrically charged tackle at the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.furycutter.desc: The target is slashed with scythes or claws. This attack becomes more powerful if it hits in succession.
cobblemon.move.steelwing.desc: The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also raise the user’s Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.meanlook.desc: The user pins the target with a dark, arresting look. The target becomes unable to flee.
cobblemon.move.attract.desc: If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
cobblemon.move.sleeptalk.desc: While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the moves it knows.
cobblemon.move.healbell.desc: The user makes a soothing bell chime to heal the status conditions of all the party Pokémon.
cobblemon.move.return.desc: This full-power attack grows more powerful the more the user likes its Trainer.
cobblemon.move.present.desc: The user attacks by giving the target a gift with a hidden trap. It restores HP sometimes, however.
cobblemon.move.frustration.desc: This full-power attack grows more powerful the less the user likes its Trainer.
cobblemon.move.safeguard.desc: The user creates a protective field that prevents status conditions for five turns.
cobblemon.move.painsplit.desc: The user adds its HP to the target’s HP, then equally shares the combined HP with the target.
cobblemon.move.sacredfire.desc: The target is razed with a mystical fire of great intensity. This may also leave the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.magnitude.desc: The user attacks everything around it with a ground-shaking quake. Its power varies.
cobblemon.move.dynamicpunch.desc: The user punches the target with full, concentrated power. This confuses the target if it hits.
cobblemon.move.megahorn.desc: Using its tough and impressive horn, the user rams into the target with no letup.
cobblemon.move.dragonbreath.desc: The user exhales a mighty gust that inflicts damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.batonpass.desc: The user switches places with a party Pokémon in waiting and passes along any stat changes.
cobblemon.move.encore.desc: The user compels the target to keep using the move it encored for three turns.
cobblemon.move.pursuit.desc: The power of this attack move is doubled if it’s used on a target that’s switching out of battle.
cobblemon.move.rapidspin.desc: A spin attack that can also eliminate such moves as Bind, Wrap, Leech Seed, and Spikes.
cobblemon.move.sweetscent.desc: A sweet scent that harshly lowers opposing Pokémon’s evasiveness.
cobblemon.move.irontail.desc: The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.metalclaw.desc: The target is raked with steel claws. This may also raise the user’s Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.vitalthrow.desc: The user attacks last. In return, this throw move never misses.
cobblemon.move.morningsun.desc: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
cobblemon.move.synthesis.desc: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
cobblemon.move.moonlight.desc: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
cobblemon.move.hiddenpower.desc: A unique attack that varies in type depending on the Pokémon using it.
cobblemon.move.crosschop.desc: The user delivers a double chop with its forearms crossed. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.twister.desc: The user whips up a vicious tornado to tear at the opposing Pokémon. This may also make them flinch.
cobblemon.move.raindance.desc: The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers the power of Fire-type moves.
cobblemon.move.sunnyday.desc: The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of Water-type moves.
cobblemon.move.crunch.desc: The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.mirrorcoat.desc: A retaliation move that counters any special attack, inflicting double the damage taken.
cobblemon.move.psychup.desc: The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat change made by the target.
cobblemon.move.extremespeed.desc: The user charges the target at blinding speed. This move always goes first.
cobblemon.move.ancientpower.desc: The user attacks with a prehistoric power. This may also raise all the user’s stats at once.
cobblemon.move.shadowball.desc: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.futuresight.desc: Two turns after this move is used, a hunk of psychic energy attacks the target.
cobblemon.move.rocksmash.desc: The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.whirlpool.desc: The user traps the target in a violent swirling whirlpool for four to five turns.
cobblemon.move.beatup.desc: The user gets all party Pokémon to attack the target. The more party Pokémon, the greater the number of attacks.
cobblemon.move.fakeout.desc: This attack hits first and makes the target flinch. It only works the first turn the user is in battle.
cobblemon.move.uproar.desc: The user attacks in an uproar for three turns. During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.
cobblemon.move.stockpile.desc: The user charges up power and raises both its Defense and Sp. Def stats. The move can be used three times.
cobblemon.move.spitup.desc: The power stored using the move Stockpile is released at once in an attack. The more power is stored, the greater the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.swallow.desc: The power stored using the move Stockpile is absorbed by the user to heal its HP. Storing more power heals more HP.
cobblemon.move.heatwave.desc: The user attacks by exhaling hot breath on the opposing Pokémon. This may also leave those Pokémon with a burn.
cobblemon.move.hail.desc: The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns. It damages all Pokémon except the Ice type.
cobblemon.move.torment.desc: The user torments and enrages the target, making it incapable of using the same move twice in a row.
cobblemon.move.flatter.desc: Flattery is used to confuse the target. However, this also raises the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.willowisp.desc: The user shoots a sinister, bluish-white flame at the target to inflict a burn.
cobblemon.move.memento.desc: The user faints when using this move. In return, this harshly lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
cobblemon.move.facade.desc: This attack move doubles its power if the user is poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
cobblemon.move.focuspunch.desc: The user focuses its mind before launching a punch. This move fails if the user is hit before it is used.
cobblemon.move.smellingsalts.desc: This attack’s power is doubled when used on a target with paralysis. This also cures the target’s paralysis, however.
cobblemon.move.followme.desc: The user draws attention to itself, making all targets take aim only at the user.
cobblemon.move.naturepower.desc: This attack makes use of nature’s power. Its effects vary depending on the user’s environment.
cobblemon.move.charge.desc: The user boosts the power of the Electric move it uses on the next turn. This also raises the user’s Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.taunt.desc: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack moves for three turns.
cobblemon.move.helpinghand.desc: The user assists an ally by boosting the power of that ally’s attack.
cobblemon.move.trick.desc: The user catches the target off guard and swaps its held item with its own.
cobblemon.move.roleplay.desc: The user mimics the target completely, copying the target’s natural Ability.
cobblemon.move.wish.desc: One turn after this move is used, the user’s or its replacement’s HP is restored by half the user’s max HP.
cobblemon.move.assist.desc: The user hurriedly and randomly uses a move among those known by ally Pokémon.
cobblemon.move.ingrain.desc: The user lays roots that restore its HP on every turn. Because it’s rooted, it can’t switch out.
cobblemon.move.superpower.desc: The user attacks the target with great power. However, this also lowers the user’s Attack and Defense stats.
cobblemon.move.magiccoat.desc: A barrier reflects back to the target moves like Leech Seed and moves that damage status.
cobblemon.move.recycle.desc: The user recycles a held item that has been used in battle so it can be used again.
cobblemon.move.revenge.desc: This attack move’s power is doubled if the user has been hurt by the opponent in the same turn.
cobblemon.move.brickbreak.desc: The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
cobblemon.move.yawn.desc: The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target into falling asleep on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.knockoff.desc: The user slaps down the target’s held item, and that item can’t be used in that battle. The move does more damage if the target has a held item.
cobblemon.move.endeavor.desc: This attack move cuts down the target’s HP to equal the user’s HP.
cobblemon.move.eruption.desc: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with explosive fury. The lower the user’s HP, the lower the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.skillswap.desc: The user employs its psychic power to exchange Abilities with the target.
cobblemon.move.imprison.desc: If opposing Pokémon know any move also known by the user, they are prevented from using it.
cobblemon.move.refresh.desc: The user rests to cure itself of poisoning, a burn, or paralysis.
cobblemon.move.grudge.desc: If the user faints, the user’s grudge fully depletes the PP of the opponent’s move that knocked it out.
cobblemon.move.snatch.desc: The user steals the effects of any attempts to use a healing or stat-changing move.
cobblemon.move.secretpower.desc: The additional effects of this attack depend upon where it was used.
cobblemon.move.dive.desc: Diving on the first turn, the user floats up and attacks on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.armthrust.desc: The user lets loose a flurry of open-palmed arm thrusts that hit two to five times in a row.
cobblemon.move.camouflage.desc: The user’s type is changed depending on its environment, such as at water’s edge, in grass, or in a cave.
cobblemon.move.tailglow.desc: The user stares at flashing lights to focus its mind, drastically raising its Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.lusterpurge.desc: The user lets loose a damaging burst of light. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.mistball.desc: A mist-like flurry of down envelops and damages the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.featherdance.desc: The user covers the target’s body with a mass of down that harshly lowers its Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.teeterdance.desc: The user performs a wobbly dance that confuses the Pokémon around it.
cobblemon.move.blazekick.desc: The user launches a kick that lands a critical hit more easily. This may also leave the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.mudsport.desc: The user kicks up mud on the battlefield. This weakens Electric-type moves for five turns.
cobblemon.move.iceball.desc: The user attacks the target for five turns. The move’s power increases each time it hits.
cobblemon.move.needlearm.desc: The user attacks by wildly swinging its thorny arms. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.slackoff.desc: The user slacks off, restoring its own HP by up to half of its max HP.
cobblemon.move.hypervoice.desc: The user lets loose a horribly echoing shout with the power to inflict damage.
cobblemon.move.poisonfang.desc: The user bites the target with toxic fangs. This may also leave the target badly poisoned.
cobblemon.move.crushclaw.desc: The user slashes the target with hard and sharp claws. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.blastburn.desc: The target is razed by a fiery explosion. The user can’t move on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.hydrocannon.desc: The target is hit with a watery blast. The user can’t move on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.meteormash.desc: The target is hit with a hard punch fired like a meteor. This may also raise the user’s Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.astonish.desc: The user attacks the target while shouting in a startling fashion. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.weatherball.desc: This attack move varies in power and type depending on the weather.
cobblemon.move.aromatherapy.desc: The user releases a soothing scent that heals all status conditions affecting the user’s party.
cobblemon.move.faketears.desc: The user feigns crying to fluster the target, harshly lowering its Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.aircutter.desc: The user launches razor-like wind to slash the opposing Pokémon. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.overheat.desc: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.odorsleuth.desc: Enables a Ghost-type target to be hit by Normal- and Fighting-type attacks. This also enables an evasive target to be hit.
cobblemon.move.rocktomb.desc: Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
cobblemon.move.silverwind.desc: The target is attacked with powdery scales blown by the wind. This may also raise all the user’s stats.
cobblemon.move.metalsound.desc: A horrible sound like scraping metal harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.grasswhistle.desc: The user plays a pleasant melody that lulls the target into a deep sleep.
cobblemon.move.tickle.desc: The user tickles the target into laughing, reducing its Attack and Defense stats.
cobblemon.move.cosmicpower.desc: The user absorbs a mystical power from space to raise its Defense and Sp. Def stats.
cobblemon.move.waterspout.desc: The user spouts water to damage opposing Pokémon. The lower the user’s HP, the lower the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.signalbeam.desc: The user attacks with a sinister beam of light. This may also confuse the target.
cobblemon.move.shadowpunch.desc: The user throws a punch from the shadows. This attack never misses.
cobblemon.move.extrasensory.desc: The user attacks with an odd, unseeable power. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.skyuppercut.desc: The user attacks the target with an uppercut thrown skyward with force.
cobblemon.move.sandtomb.desc: The user traps the target inside a harshly raging sandstorm for four to five turns.
cobblemon.move.sheercold.desc: The target faints instantly. It’s less likely to hit the target if it’s used by Pokémon other than Ice types.
cobblemon.move.muddywater.desc: The user attacks by shooting muddy water at the opposing Pokémon. This may also lower their accuracy.
cobblemon.move.bulletseed.desc: The user forcefully shoots seeds at the target two to five times in a row.
cobblemon.move.aerialace.desc: The user confounds the target with speed, then slashes. This attack never misses.
cobblemon.move.iciclespear.desc: The user launches sharp icicles at the target two to five times in a row.
cobblemon.move.irondefense.desc: The user hardens its body’s surface like iron, sharply raising its Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.block.desc: The user blocks the target’s way with arms spread wide to prevent escape.
cobblemon.move.howl.desc: The user howls loudly to raise its spirit, which raises its Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.dragonclaw.desc: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.
cobblemon.move.frenzyplant.desc: The user slams the target with an enormous tree. The user can’t move on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.bulkup.desc: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body, raising both its Attack and Defense stats.
cobblemon.move.bounce.desc: The user bounces up high, then drops on the target on the second turn. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.mudshot.desc: The user attacks by hurling a blob of mud at the target. This also lowers the target’s Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.poisontail.desc: The user hits the target with its tail. This may also poison the target. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.covet.desc: The user endearingly approaches the target, then steals the target’s held item.
cobblemon.move.volttackle.desc: The user electrifies itself and charges the target. This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack may leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.magicalleaf.desc: The user scatters curious leaves that chase the target. This attack never misses.
cobblemon.move.watersport.desc: The user soaks the battlefield with water. This weakens Fire-type moves for five turns.
cobblemon.move.calmmind.desc: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.
cobblemon.move.leafblade.desc: The user handles a sharp leaf like a sword and attacks by cutting its target. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.dragondance.desc: The user vigorously performs a mystic, powerful dance that raises its Attack and Speed stats.
cobblemon.move.rockblast.desc: The user hurls hard rocks at the target. Two to five rocks are launched in a row.
cobblemon.move.shockwave.desc: The user strikes the target with a quick jolt of electricity. This attack never misses.
cobblemon.move.waterpulse.desc: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. This may also confuse the target.
cobblemon.move.doomdesire.desc: Two turns after this move is used, a concentrated bundle of light blasts the target.
cobblemon.move.psychoboost.desc: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.roost.desc: The user lands and rests its body. It restores the user’s HP by up to half of its max HP.
cobblemon.move.gravity.desc: Enables Flying-type Pokémon or Pokémon with the Levitate Ability to be hit by Ground-type moves. Flying moves can’t be used.
cobblemon.move.miracleeye.desc: Enables a Dark-type target to be hit by Psychic-type attacks. This also enables an evasive target to be hit.
cobblemon.move.wakeupslap.desc: This attack inflicts big damage on a sleeping target. This also wakes the target up, however.
cobblemon.move.hammerarm.desc: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user’s Speed, however.
cobblemon.move.gyroball.desc: The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin. The slower the user compared to the target, the greater the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.healingwish.desc: The user faints. In return, the Pokémon taking its place will have its HP restored and status conditions cured.
cobblemon.move.brine.desc: If the target’s HP is half or less, this attack will hit with double the power.
cobblemon.move.naturalgift.desc: The user draws power to attack by using its held Berry. The Berry determines the move’s type and power.
cobblemon.move.feint.desc: This attack hits a target using a move such as Protect or Detect. This also lifts the effects of those moves.
cobblemon.move.pluck.desc: The user pecks the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
cobblemon.move.tailwind.desc: The user whips up a turbulent whirlwind that ups the Speed stat of the user and its allies for four turns.
cobblemon.move.acupressure.desc: The user applies pressure to stress points, sharply boosting one of its or its allies’ stats.
cobblemon.move.metalburst.desc: The user retaliates with much greater force against the opponent that last inflicted damage on it.
cobblemon.move.uturn.desc: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
cobblemon.move.closecombat.desc: The user fights the target up close without guarding itself. This also lowers the user’s Defense and Sp. Def stats.
cobblemon.move.payback.desc: The user stores power, then attacks. If the user moves after the target, this attack’s power will be doubled.
cobblemon.move.assurance.desc: If the target has already taken some damage in the same turn, this attack’s power is doubled.
cobblemon.move.embargo.desc: This move prevents the target from using its held item for five turns. Its Trainer is also prevented from using items on it.
cobblemon.move.fling.desc: The user flings its held item at the target to attack. This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
cobblemon.move.psychoshift.desc: Using its psychic power of suggestion, the user transfers its status conditions to the target.
cobblemon.move.trumpcard.desc: The fewer PP this move has, the greater its power.
cobblemon.move.healblock.desc: For five turns, the user prevents the opposing team from using any moves, Abilities, or held items that recover HP.
cobblemon.move.wringout.desc: The user powerfully wrings the target. The more HP the target has, the greater the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.powertrick.desc: The user employs its psychic power to switch its Attack stat with its Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.gastroacid.desc: The user hurls up its stomach acids on the target. The fluid eliminates the effect of the target’s Ability.
cobblemon.move.luckychant.desc: The user chants an incantation toward the sky, preventing opposing Pokémon from landing critical hits for five turns.
cobblemon.move.mefirst.desc: The user cuts ahead of the target to copy and use the target’s intended move with greater power. This move fails if it isn’t used first.
cobblemon.move.copycat.desc: The user mimics the move used immediately before it. The move fails if no other move has been used yet.
cobblemon.move.powerswap.desc: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with the target.
cobblemon.move.guardswap.desc: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Defense and Sp. Def stats with the target.
cobblemon.move.punishment.desc: The more the target has powered up with stat changes, the greater the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.lastresort.desc: This move can be used only after the user has used all the other moves it knows in the battle.
cobblemon.move.worryseed.desc: A seed that causes worry is planted on the target. It prevents sleep by making the target’s Ability Insomnia.
cobblemon.move.suckerpunch.desc: This move enables the user to attack first. This move fails if the target is not readying an attack.
cobblemon.move.toxicspikes.desc: The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team. The spikes will poison opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
cobblemon.move.heartswap.desc: The user employs its psychic power to switch stat changes with the target.
cobblemon.move.aquaring.desc: The user envelops itself in a veil made of water. It regains some HP every turn.
cobblemon.move.magnetrise.desc: The user levitates using electrically generated magnetism for five turns.
cobblemon.move.flareblitz.desc: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges the target. This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack may leave the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.forcepalm.desc: The target is attacked with a shock wave. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.aurasphere.desc: The user lets loose a blast of aura power from deep within its body at the target. This attack never misses.
cobblemon.move.rockpolish.desc: The user polishes its body to reduce drag. This can sharply raise the Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.poisonjab.desc: The target is stabbed with a tentacle or arm steeped in poison. This may also poison the target.
cobblemon.move.darkpulse.desc: The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark thoughts. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.nightslash.desc: The user slashes the target the instant an opportunity arises. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.aquatail.desc: The user attacks by swinging its tail as if it were a vicious wave in a raging storm.
cobblemon.move.seedbomb.desc: The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled seeds down on the target from above.
cobblemon.move.airslash.desc: The user attacks with a blade of air that slices even the sky. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.xscissor.desc: The user slashes at the target by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.
cobblemon.move.bugbuzz.desc: The user generates a damaging sound wave by vibration. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.dragonpulse.desc: The target is attacked with a shock wave generated by the user’s gaping mouth.
cobblemon.move.dragonrush.desc: The user tackles the target while exhibiting overwhelming menace. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.powergem.desc: The user attacks with a ray of light that sparkles as if it were made of gemstones.
cobblemon.move.drainpunch.desc: An energy-draining punch. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
cobblemon.move.vacuumwave.desc: The user whirls its fists to send a wave of pure vacuum at the target. This move always goes first.
cobblemon.move.focusblast.desc: The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes its power. This may also lower the target’s  Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.energyball.desc: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.bravebird.desc: The user tucks in its wings and charges from a low altitude. This also damages the user quite a lot.
cobblemon.move.earthpower.desc: The user makes the ground under the target erupt with power. This may also lower the target’s  Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.switcheroo.desc: The user trades held items with the target faster than the eye can follow.
cobblemon.move.gigaimpact.desc: The user charges at the target using every bit of its power. The user can’t move on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.nastyplot.desc: The user stimulates its brain by thinking bad thoughts. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.bulletpunch.desc: The user strikes the target with tough punches as fast as bullets. This move always goes first.
cobblemon.move.avalanche.desc: The power of this attack move is doubled if the user has been hurt by the target in the same turn.
cobblemon.move.iceshard.desc: The user flash-freezes chunks of ice and hurls them at the target. This move always goes first.
cobblemon.move.shadowclaw.desc: The user slashes with a sharp claw made from shadows. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.thunderfang.desc: The user bites with electrified fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.icefang.desc: The user bites with cold-infused fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it frozen.
cobblemon.move.firefang.desc: The user bites with flame-cloaked fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it with a burn.
cobblemon.move.shadowsneak.desc: The user extends its shadow and attacks the target from behind. This move always goes first.
cobblemon.move.mudbomb.desc: The user launches a hard-packed mud ball to attack. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
cobblemon.move.psychocut.desc: The user tears at the target with blades formed by psychic power. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.zenheadbutt.desc: The user focuses its willpower to its head and attacks the target. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.mirrorshot.desc: The user lets loose a flash of energy at the target from its polished body. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
cobblemon.move.flashcannon.desc: The user gathers all its light energy and releases it all at once. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.rockclimb.desc: The user attacks the target by smashing into it with incredible force. This may also confuse the target.
cobblemon.move.defog.desc: A strong wind blows away the target’s barriers such as Reflect or Light Screen. This also lowers the target’s evasiveness.
cobblemon.move.trickroom.desc: The user creates a bizarre area in which slower Pokémon get to move first for five turns.
cobblemon.move.dracometeor.desc: Comets are summoned down from the sky onto the target. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.discharge.desc: The user strikes everything around it by letting loose a flare of electricity. This may also cause paralysis.
cobblemon.move.lavaplume.desc: The user torches everything around it in an inferno of scarlet flames. This may also leave those it hits with a burn.
cobblemon.move.leafstorm.desc: The user whips up a storm of leaves around the target. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.powerwhip.desc: The user violently whirls its vines, tentacles, or the  like to harshly lash the target.
cobblemon.move.rockwrecker.desc: The user launches a huge boulder at the target to attack. The user can’t move on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.crosspoison.desc: A slashing attack with a poisonous blade that may also poison the target. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.gunkshot.desc: The user shoots filthy garbage at the target to attack. This may also poison the target.
cobblemon.move.ironhead.desc: The user slams the target with its steel-hard head. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.magnetbomb.desc: The user launches steel bombs that stick to the target. This attack never misses.
cobblemon.move.stoneedge.desc: The user stabs the target from below with sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.captivate.desc: If any opposing Pokémon is the opposite gender of the user, it is charmed, which harshly lowers its Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.stealthrock.desc: The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the opposing team. The trap hurts opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
cobblemon.move.grassknot.desc: The user snares the target with grass and trips it. The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.chatter.desc: The user attacks the target with sound waves of deafening chatter. This confuses the target.
cobblemon.move.judgment.desc: The user releases countless shots of light at the target. This move’s type varies depending on the kind of Plate the user is holding.
cobblemon.move.bugbite.desc: The user bites the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
cobblemon.move.chargebeam.desc: The user attacks with an electric charge. The user may use any remaining electricity to raise its Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.woodhammer.desc: The user slams its rugged body into the target to attack. This also damages the user quite a lot.
cobblemon.move.aquajet.desc: The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
cobblemon.move.attackorder.desc: The user calls out its underlings to pummel the target. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.defendorder.desc: The user calls out its underlings to shield its body, raising its Defense and Sp. Def stats.
cobblemon.move.healorder.desc: The user calls out its underlings to heal it. The user regains up to half of its max HP.
cobblemon.move.headsmash.desc: The user attacks the target with a hazardous, full-power headbutt. This also damages the user terribly.
cobblemon.move.doublehit.desc: The user slams the target with a long tail, vines, or a tentacle. The target is hit twice in a row.
cobblemon.move.roaroftime.desc: The user blasts the target with power that distorts even time. The user can’t move on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.spacialrend.desc: The user tears the target along with the space around it. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.lunardance.desc: The user faints. In return, the Pokémon taking its place will have its status and HP fully restored.
cobblemon.move.crushgrip.desc: The target is crushed with great force. The more HP the target has left, the greater this move’s power.
cobblemon.move.magmastorm.desc: The target becomes trapped within a maelstrom of fire that rages for four to five turns.
cobblemon.move.darkvoid.desc: Opposing Pokémon are dragged into a world of total darkness that makes them sleep.
cobblemon.move.seedflare.desc: The user emits a shock wave from its body to attack its target. This may also harshly lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.ominouswind.desc: The user blasts the target with a gust of repulsive wind. This may also raise all the user’s stats at once.
cobblemon.move.shadowforce.desc: The user disappears, then strikes the target on the next turn. This move hits even if the target protects itself.
cobblemon.move.honeclaws.desc: The user sharpens its claws to boost its Attack stat and accuracy.
cobblemon.move.wideguard.desc: The user and its allies are protected from wide-ranging attacks for one turn.
cobblemon.move.guardsplit.desc: The user employs its psychic power to average its Defense and Sp. Def stats with those of the target.
cobblemon.move.powersplit.desc: The user employs its psychic power to average its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with those of the target.
cobblemon.move.wonderroom.desc: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def stats are swapped for five turns.
cobblemon.move.psyshock.desc: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This attack does physical damage.
cobblemon.move.venoshock.desc: The user drenches the target in a special poisonous liquid. This move’s power is doubled if the target is poisoned.
cobblemon.move.autotomize.desc: The user sheds part of its body to make itself lighter and sharply raise its Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.ragepowder.desc: The user scatters a cloud of irritating powder to draw attention to itself. Opponents aim only at the user.
cobblemon.move.telekinesis.desc: The user makes the target float with its psychic power. The target is easier to hit for three turns.
cobblemon.move.magicroom.desc: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon’s held items lose their effects for five turns.
cobblemon.move.smackdown.desc: The user throws a stone or similar projectile to attack an opponent. A flying Pokémon will fall to the ground when it’s hit.
cobblemon.move.stormthrow.desc: The user strikes the target with a fierce blow. This attack always results in a critical hit.
cobblemon.move.flameburst.desc: The user attacks the target with a bursting flame. The bursting flame damages Pokémon next to the target as well.
cobblemon.move.sludgewave.desc: The user strikes everything around it by swamping the area with a giant sludge wave. This may also poison those hit.
cobblemon.move.quiverdance.desc: The user lightly performs a beautiful, mystic dance. This boosts the user’s Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.
cobblemon.move.heavyslam.desc: The user slams into the target with its heavy body. The more the user outweighs the target, the greater the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.synchronoise.desc: Using an odd shock wave, the user inflicts damage on any Pokémon of the same type in the area around it.
cobblemon.move.electroball.desc: The user hurls an electric orb at the target. The faster the user is than the target, the greater the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.soak.desc: The user shoots a torrent of water at the target and changes the target’s type to Water.
cobblemon.move.flamecharge.desc: Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks. Then, building up more power, the user raises its Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.coil.desc: The user coils up and concentrates. This raises its Attack and Defense stats as well as its accuracy.
cobblemon.move.lowsweep.desc: The user makes a swift attack on the target’s legs, which lowers the target’s Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.acidspray.desc: The user spits fluid that works to melt the target. This harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
cobblemon.move.foulplay.desc: The user turns the target’s power against it. The higher the target’s Attack stat, the greater the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.simplebeam.desc: The user’s mysterious psychic wave changes the target’s Ability to Simple.
cobblemon.move.entrainment.desc: The user dances with an odd rhythm that compels the target to mimic it, making the target’s Ability the same as the user’s.
cobblemon.move.afteryou.desc: The user helps the target and makes it use its move right after the user.
cobblemon.move.round.desc: The user attacks the target with a song. Others can join in the Round to increase the power of the attack.
cobblemon.move.echoedvoice.desc: The user attacks the target with an echoing voice. If this move is used every turn, its power is increased.
cobblemon.move.chipaway.desc: Looking for an opening, the user strikes consistently. The target’s stat changes don’t affect this attack’s damage.
cobblemon.move.clearsmog.desc: The user attacks by throwing a clump of special mud. All stat changes are returned to normal.
cobblemon.move.storedpower.desc: The user attacks the target with stored power. The more the user’s stats are raised, the greater the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.quickguard.desc: The user protects itself and its allies from priority moves.
cobblemon.move.allyswitch.desc: The user teleports using a strange power and switches places with one of its allies.
cobblemon.move.scald.desc: The user shoots boiling hot water at its target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.shellsmash.desc: The user breaks its shell, which lowers Defense and Sp. Def stats but sharply raises its Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats.
cobblemon.move.healpulse.desc: The user emits a healing pulse that restores the target’s HP by up to half of its max HP.
cobblemon.move.hex.desc: This relentless attack does massive damage to a target affected by status conditions.
cobblemon.move.skydrop.desc: The user takes the target into the sky, then drops it during the next turn. The target cannot attack while in the sky.
cobblemon.move.shiftgear.desc: The user rotates its gears, raising its Attack stat and sharply raising its Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.circlethrow.desc: The target is thrown, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
cobblemon.move.incinerate.desc: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with fire. If a Pokémon is holding a certain item, such as a Berry, the item becomes burned up and unusable.
cobblemon.move.quash.desc: The user suppresses the target and makes its move go last.
cobblemon.move.acrobatics.desc: The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
cobblemon.move.reflecttype.desc: The user reflects the target’s type, making it the same type as the target.
cobblemon.move.retaliate.desc: The user gets revenge for a fainted ally. If an ally fainted in the previous turn, this move’s power is increased.
cobblemon.move.finalgambit.desc: The user risks everything to attack its target. The user faints but does damage equal to its HP.
cobblemon.move.bestow.desc: The user passes its held item to the target when the target isn’t holding an item.
cobblemon.move.inferno.desc: The user attacks by engulfing the target in an intense fire. This leaves the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.waterpledge.desc: A column of water strikes the target. When combined with its fire equivalent, its power increases and a rainbow appears.
cobblemon.move.firepledge.desc: A column of fire hits the target. When used with its grass equivalent, its power increases and a vast sea of fire appears.
cobblemon.move.grasspledge.desc: A column of grass hits the target. When used with its water equivalent, its power increases and a vast swamp appears.
cobblemon.move.voltswitch.desc: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
cobblemon.move.strugglebug.desc: While resisting, the user attacks the opposing Pokémon. This lowers the Sp. Atk stat of those hit.
cobblemon.move.bulldoze.desc: The user strikes everything around it by stomping down on the ground. This lowers the Speed stat of those hit.
cobblemon.move.frostbreath.desc: The user blows its cold breath on the target. This attack always results in a critical hit.
cobblemon.move.dragontail.desc: The target is knocked away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
cobblemon.move.workup.desc: The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk stats increase.
cobblemon.move.electroweb.desc: The user attacks and captures opposing Pokémon using an electric net. This lowers their Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.wildcharge.desc: The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes into its target. This also damages the user a little.
cobblemon.move.drillrun.desc: The user crashes into its target while rotating its body like a drill. Critical hits land more easily.
cobblemon.move.dualchop.desc: The user attacks its target by hitting it with brutal strikes. The target is hit twice in a row.
cobblemon.move.heartstamp.desc: The user unleashes a vicious blow after its cute act makes the target less wary. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.hornleech.desc: The user drains the target’s energy with its horns. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
cobblemon.move.sacredsword.desc: The user attacks by slicing with a long horn. The target’s stat changes don’t affect this attack’s damage.
cobblemon.move.razorshell.desc: The user cuts its target with sharp shells. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.heatcrash.desc: The user slams its target with its flame-covered body. The more the user outweighs the target, the greater the move’s power.
cobblemon.move.leaftornado.desc: The user attacks its target by encircling it in sharp leaves. This attack may also lower the target’s accuracy.
cobblemon.move.steamroller.desc: The user crushes its target by rolling over the target with its rolled-up body. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.cottonguard.desc: The user protects itself by wrapping its body in soft cotton, which drastically raises the user’s Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.nightdaze.desc: The user lets loose a pitch-black shock wave at its target. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
cobblemon.move.psystrike.desc: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This attack does physical damage.
cobblemon.move.tailslap.desc: The user attacks by striking the target with its hard tail. It hits the target two to five times in a row.
cobblemon.move.hurricane.desc: The user attacks by wrapping its opponent in a fierce wind that flies up into the sky. This may also confuse the target.
cobblemon.move.headcharge.desc: The user charges its head into its target, using its powerful guard hair. This also damages the user a little.
cobblemon.move.geargrind.desc: The user attacks by throwing steel gears at its target twice.
cobblemon.move.searingshot.desc: The user torches everything around it in an inferno of scarlet flames. This may also leave those it hits with a burn.
cobblemon.move.technoblast.desc: The user fires a beam of light at its target. The move’s type changes depending on the Drive the user holds.
cobblemon.move.relicsong.desc: The user sings an ancient song and attacks by appealing to the hearts of the listening opposing Pokémon. This may also induce sleep.
cobblemon.move.secretsword.desc: The user cuts with its long horn. The odd power contained in the horn does physical damage to the target.
cobblemon.move.glaciate.desc: The user attacks by blowing freezing cold air at opposing Pokémon. This lowers their Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.boltstrike.desc: The user surrounds itself with a great amount of electricity and charges its target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.blueflare.desc: The user attacks by engulfing the target in an intense, yet beautiful, blue flame. This may also leave the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.fierydance.desc: Cloaked in flames, the user dances and flaps its wings. This may also raise the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.freezeshock.desc: On the second turn, the user hits the target with electrically charged ice. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.iceburn.desc: On the second turn, an ultracold, freezing wind surrounds the target. This may leave the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.snarl.desc: The user yells as if it’s ranting about something, which lowers the Sp. Atk stat of opposing Pokémon.
cobblemon.move.iciclecrash.desc: The user attacks by harshly dropping large icicles onto the target. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.vcreate.desc: With a hot flame on its forehead, the user hurls itself at its target. This lowers the user’s Defense, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.
cobblemon.move.fusionflare.desc: The user brings down a giant flame. This move’s power is increased when influenced by an enormous lightning bolt.
cobblemon.move.fusionbolt.desc: The user throws down a giant lightning bolt. This move’s power is increased when influenced by an enormous flame.
cobblemon.move.flyingpress.desc: The user dives down onto the target from the sky. This move is Fighting and Flying type simultaneously.
cobblemon.move.matblock.desc: Using a pulled-up mat as a shield, the user protects itself and its allies from damaging moves. This does not stop status moves.
cobblemon.move.belch.desc: The user lets out a damaging belch at the target. The user must eat a held Berry to use this move.
cobblemon.move.rototiller.desc: Tilling the soil, the user makes it easier for plants to grow. This raises the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of Grass-type Pokémon.
cobblemon.move.stickyweb.desc: The user weaves a sticky net around the opposing team, which lowers their Speed stat upon switching into battle.
cobblemon.move.fellstinger.desc: When the user knocks out a target with this move, the user’s Attack stat rises drastically.
cobblemon.move.phantomforce.desc: The user vanishes somewhere, then strikes the target on the next turn. This move hits even if the target protects itself.
cobblemon.move.trickortreat.desc: The user takes the target trick-or-treating. This adds Ghost type to the target’s type.
cobblemon.move.nobleroar.desc: Letting out a noble roar, the user intimidates the target and lowers its Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
cobblemon.move.iondeluge.desc: The user disperses electrically charged particles, which changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type moves.
cobblemon.move.paraboliccharge.desc: The user attacks everything around it. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by those hit.
cobblemon.move.forestscurse.desc: The user puts a forest curse on the target. The target is now Grass type as well.
cobblemon.move.petalblizzard.desc: The user stirs up a violent petal blizzard and attacks everything around it.
cobblemon.move.freezedry.desc: The user rapidly cools the target. This may also leave the target frozen. This move is super effective on Water types.
cobblemon.move.disarmingvoice.desc: Letting out a charming cry, the user does emotional damage to opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.
cobblemon.move.partingshot.desc: With a parting threat, the user lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats. Then it switches with a party Pokémon.
cobblemon.move.topsyturvy.desc: All stat changes affecting the target turn topsy-turvy and become the opposite of what they were.
cobblemon.move.drainingkiss.desc: The user steals the target’s HP with a kiss. The user’s HP is restored by over half of the damage taken by the target.
cobblemon.move.craftyshield.desc: The user protects itself and its allies from status moves with a mysterious power. This does not stop moves that do damage.
cobblemon.move.flowershield.desc: The user raises the Defense stat of all Grass-type Pokémon in battle with a mysterious power.
cobblemon.move.grassyterrain.desc: The user turns the ground to grass for five turns. This restores the HP of Pokémon on the ground a little every turn and powers up Grass type-moves.
cobblemon.move.mistyterrain.desc: This protects Pokémon on the ground from status conditions and halves damage from Dragon-type moves for five turns.
cobblemon.move.electrify.desc: If the target is electrified before it uses a move during that turn, the target’s move becomes Electric type.
cobblemon.move.playrough.desc: The user plays rough with the target and attacks it. This may also lower the target’s Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.fairywind.desc: The user stirs up a fairy wind and strikes the target with it.
cobblemon.move.moonblast.desc: Borrowing the power of the moon, the user attacks the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.boomburst.desc: The user attacks everything around it with the destructive power of a terrible, explosive sound.
cobblemon.move.fairylock.desc: By locking down the battlefield, the user keeps all Pokémon from fleeing during the next turn.
cobblemon.move.kingsshield.desc: The user takes a defensive stance while it protects itself from damage. It also harshly lowers the Attack stat of any attacker who makes direct contact.
cobblemon.move.playnice.desc: The user and the target become friends, and the target loses its will to fight. This lowers the target’s Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.confide.desc: The user tells the target a secret, and the target loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.diamondstorm.desc: The user whips up a storm of diamonds to damage opposing Pokémon. This may also sharply raise the user’s Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.steameruption.desc: The user immerses the target in superheated steam. This may also leave the target with a burn.
cobblemon.move.hyperspacehole.desc: Using a hyperspace hole, the user appears right next to the target and strikes. This also hits a target using a move such as Protect or Detect.
cobblemon.move.watershuriken.desc: The user hits the target with throwing stars two to five times in a row. This move always goes first.
cobblemon.move.mysticalfire.desc: The user attacks by breathing a special, hot fire. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.spikyshield.desc: In addition to protecting the user from attacks, this move also damages any attacker who makes direct contact.
cobblemon.move.aromaticmist.desc: The user raises the Sp. Def stat of an ally Pokémon by using a mysterious aroma.
cobblemon.move.eerieimpulse.desc: The user’s body generates an eerie impulse. Exposing the target to it harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.move.venomdrench.desc: Opposing Pokémon are drenched in an odd poisonous liquid. This lowers the Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats of a poisoned target.
cobblemon.move.powder.desc: The user covers the target in a combustible powder. If the target uses a Fire-type move, the powder explodes and damages the target.
cobblemon.move.geomancy.desc: The user absorbs energy and sharply raises its Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.magneticflux.desc: The user manipulates magnetic fields, which raises the Defense and Sp. Def stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.
cobblemon.move.happyhour.desc: Using Happy Hour doubles the amount of prize money received after battle.
cobblemon.move.electricterrain.desc: The user electrifies the ground for five turns, powering up Electric-type moves. Pokémon on the ground no longer fall asleep.
cobblemon.move.dazzlinggleam.desc: The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a powerful flash.
cobblemon.move.celebrate.desc: The Pokémon congratulates you on your special day!
cobblemon.move.holdhands.desc: The user and an ally hold hands. This makes them very happy.
cobblemon.move.babydolleyes.desc: The user stares at the target with its baby-doll eyes, which lowers its Attack stat. This move always goes first.
cobblemon.move.nuzzle.desc: The user attacks by nuzzling its electrified cheeks against the target. This also leaves the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.holdback.desc: The user holds back when it attacks, and the target is left with at least 1 HP.
cobblemon.move.infestation.desc: The target is infested and attacked for four to five turns. The target can’t flee during this time.
cobblemon.move.poweruppunch.desc: Striking opponents over and over makes the user’s fists harder. Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.oblivionwing.desc: The user absorbs its target’s HP. The user’s HP is restored by over half of the damage taken by the target.
cobblemon.move.thousandarrows.desc: This move also hits opposing Pokémon that are in the air. Those Pokémon are knocked down to the ground.
cobblemon.move.thousandwaves.desc: The user attacks with a wave that crawls along the ground. Those hit can’t flee from battle.
cobblemon.move.landswrath.desc: The user gathers the energy of the land and focuses that power on opposing Pokémon to damage them.
cobblemon.move.lightofruin.desc: Drawing power from the Eternal Flower, the user fires a powerful beam of light. This also damages the user quite a lot.
cobblemon.move.originpulse.desc: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with countless beams of light that glow a deep and brilliant blue.
cobblemon.move.precipiceblades.desc: The user attacks opposing Pokémon by manifesting the power of the land in fearsome blades of stone.
